intro: Lampranthus matutinus, commonly known as the morning glory of the fynbos, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its succulent characteristics and ability to thrive in arid environments. The plant produces striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange, often opening in the early morning. It has small, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water, and it is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Lampranthus matutinus is a popular choice for rock gardens due to its ornamental value and low maintenance requirements.
